alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 05 at 12:08PM MST until January 06 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST /8 AM CST/ THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two to five inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 24 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas, northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM MST /8 AM CST/ Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Isolated/localized areas could see a drop around 25 below zero, especially north of Highway 36. For the Winter Weather Advisory, traffic along Interstate 70 will be affected along with roadways north. Highest snow totals expected along/east of a line from Stratton, Nebraska to Norton, Kansas.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
